result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnee M. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

in 14cf147 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 1 and 3 and dismiss and read in 14cm355  - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- guilty plea to count 2 in 14cf147 and 14cf253 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. 1:19 p.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf147, 14cf253 and 14cm355. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance.  Defendant states she had a death in family on a Wednesday after November 6, 2015. Court asks how that affected non-appearance.  Defendant states she had to go to funeral and prepare food. Michlig/Chapman statement to bail. Defendant states that her plan was to be in court for sentencing yesterday but she was picked up on warrant and had to go to jail. Court states there has been no coherent explanation as to non-appearance on November 6, 2015 and no coherent explanation to numerous warrants that have been issued. Court sets $1000 cash bond  in each of 3 cases. Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge O'Melia. Adj. 1:29 p.m.
per Mary @ ONSO - now at ONSO
Per Mary- In vilas awaiting pickup
Extradition Forecast-will not extradite

PC from Shawnee- unable to be in court today due to being out of town for family emergency- advised her to contact attorney- she hung up on me.
